In sum,the years between 1962 and 1966 saw a deepening of the urban-rural
divide, caused by stricter enforcement of the hukou system and a deliberate
reduction in the number of people entitled to access the urban welfare state.
A side-effect of these policies was tolimit social mobility for the rural population.
